name: Oil and Gas Explorer
description: Explore oil and gas production over time and with linked visualisations. Source Code.

name: Uber Rides
description: Displays all of the Uber rides in New York City in 2014. Pandas on the backend filters a 0.5gig datafile. Source Code.

name: Simple Stock Tickers
description: Queries data from Google Finance and displays the results as candlestick charts. Source Code.

name: Volatility Surface Explorer
description: Fetches CBOE options chain data from Yahoo Finance with Pandas Datareader and calculates the implied volatility of each option visualised in a 3D mesh chart. Source Code.

name: Drug Discovery
description: Displays a description of the drug as you hover over points in the graph. Source Code.

name: Live Wind Streaming
description: Continually queries a SQL database and displays live charts of wind speed and wind direction. Source Code.

name: Recession in 255 Charts
description: Adapted from NYTimes's excellent How the Recession Reshaped the Economy in 255 Charts. Source Code.

name: 3D Yield Curve
description: Adapted from NYTimes's excellent A 3-D View of a Chart That Predicts The Economic Future: The Yield Curve. Source Code.

name: Finding Bigfoot
description: Several plots (including a map), a grid layout built with Bootstrap, interactions with an input field, and caching (See also Tutorials). Source Code.

name: Visualize Earthquakes with Plotly Dash
description: Great UI and usage of geospatial analytics with Dash. Includes basic unit tests. Source Code.

name: Street Quality IDentification [SQUID]
description: Highlights poor quality roads with maps, data table and photos of the offending piece of road. Source Code.

name: VoxelViz
description: Competition winning Visualization tool for (f)MRI data-sets. Source Code.

name: Traffic Accidents UK
description: Explore the 140,008 traffic accidents in the UK in 2015. Source Code.

name: New York Taxi Rides
description: A full year of the YellowCab Taxi company data from their prime, numbering well over 100 million trips. Dash + Vaex dataframe with over a 100 million rows. Source Code.

description: Look inside the books of Project Gutenberg. Source Code.
